description: Ambitious numbers: numbers n with the property that if a number ends in n then it is divisible by n.
comments: Number whose 10's complement is a multiple of it. 125 is a member as its 10's complement is 1000-125 = 875= 125*7 - _Amarnath Murthy_, Mar 08 2002
references: P. J. Davis and R. Hersh, The Mathematical Experience, Birkhaeuser, Boston and Basel, 1981; see pp. 293-298.
links: Problem of the week, Web site - problem 881
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,0,0,10).
formula: Consists of the numbers 1, 2, 5, 25 or 125 times a power of 10.
example: If a number ends in 2 then it is even and so is divisible by 2, so 2 is in the sequence.
author: _Erich Friedman_
extensions: Entry revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 03 2004
